basics.name: Brendt McFeeley
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am a fourth year student at the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa pursing a B.S. in Computer Science. My expected graduation date is December 2018.

education.institution: University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI

work.organization: University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa - Ka Leo O Hawai'i
work.position: Web Developer, University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa - Ka Leo O Hawai'i
work.summary: Maintain websites of various student media organizations as well as the Mānoa Now mobile application.
highlights: Develop various dynamic web pages for the use in the Mānoa Now application
Maintain and improve backend of the Mānoa Now and Kaleo websites to ensure proper uptime and loading speeds for better user experience.

volunteer.summary: General Volunteer at the Hawaiian Humane Society with training for the physical health of animals
highlights: Assist families in meeting with animals they wish to adopt
Maintain animals physical health by either running or walking

awards.title: First Place Overall - Hawaii Annual Code Challenge
awards.summary: Achieved first place at the 2017 Hawaii Annual Code Challenge, a statewide month long hackathon. Built a mobile friendly wayfaring guide to be used by the University of Hawaii at Manoa.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.
